description:
Navigation Drawers are an excellent component to use to set up the initial
layout of your application. This component combines a Drawer
(a sidebar of nav items), an app bar, and displays any additional content.

The `NavigationDrawer` component is customizable to have different
display states for mobile, tablet, and desktop displays.

style.description: An optional style to apply to the entire container.

className.description: An optional className to apply to the entire container.

drawerStyle.description: An optional style to apply to the drawer.

drawerClassName.description: An optional className to apply to the drawer.

contentStyle.description: An optional style to apply to the main content.

contentClassName.description: An optional className to apply to the main content.

toolbarStyle.description: An optional style to apply to the main toolbar.

toolbarClassName.description: An optional className to applt to the main toolbar.

drawerTitle.description: An optional title to display in the navigation drawer header.

drawerChildren.description:
Any additional children you want to display in the navigation drawer header after
the optional title.

drawerHeaderFixed.description:
Boolean if the drawer header should be fixed to the top of the
sliding drawer. This will add the `className` `md-drawer-scrolling-list`
the list surrounding the `navItems`. The `md-drawer-scrolling-list`
`className` adjusts the max-height for the list content for the different
device sizes.

toolbarTitle.description: An optional title to display in the toolbar.

toolbarChildren.description:
Any additional children you want to display in the main toolbar after the menu
button (for persistent drawers) and the optional title.

initiallyOpen.description:
An optional boolean if the drawer is open for persistent or temporary
drawers.

initialDrawerType.description: The initial drawer type to render. This is used for Server Side Rendering.

mobileDrawerType.description:
The `DrawerType` to use for mobile devices. If the `mobileMinWidth` prop
matches or the `tabletMinWidth` prop matches and the orientation is portrait,
this drawer type will be used.

tabletDrawerType.description:
The `DrawerType` to use for landscape oriented tablets. If the
`tabletMinWidth` prop matches and the orientation is landscape, this drawer
type will be used.

desktopDrawerType.description:
The `DrawerType` to use for desktop displays. If the `desktopMinWidth`
prop matches, this drawer type will be used.

mobileMinWidth.description: The min width to use for a mobile media query.

tabletMinWidth.description: The min width to use for a tablet media query.

desktopMinWidth.description: The min width to use for a desktop media query.

menuIconClassName.description: The icon className to use for the main menu icon.

menuIconChildren.description: Any children required to render the main menu icon.

closeIconClassName.description: The icon className to use for closing a persistent navigation drawer.

closeIconChildren.description: Any children required to render the close icon for a persistent navigation drawer.

autoclose.description:
Boolean if the sliding drawer should automatically close when a nav item
is clicked for a temporary or temporary mini drawer.

onDrawerChange.description:
An optional function to call when the sliding drawer's open state changes.
This can happen from rotating a tablet, resizing the browser window,
or toggling the drawer for persistent and temporary versions. The
`onDrawerChange` prop will be given the new open state.

`onDrawerChange(isOpen)`

divider.name: bool
divider.description: Boolean if this item should be rendered as a divider.

subheader.name: bool
subheader.description: Boolean if this item should be rendered as a subheader.

component.name: union
component.description: An optional component to render the `ListItem` as.

primaryText.name: string
primaryText.description: The main text to be displayed in a `Subheader` or a `ListItem`.

navItems.description:
A list of items to render in the navigation drawer. If an item
is a prop object, all props will be passed to either a `ListItem`,
`Divider`, or `Subheader` component.

##### Additional Info

transitionName.description: The transition name to use for the drawer sliding in and out of view.

transitionEnterTimeout.description: The transition enter duration for the drawer sliding in to view.

transitionLeaveTimeout.description: The transition leave duration for the drawer sliding out of view.

contentTransitionName.description:
An optional transition to use when the content changes. To disable this transition,
set the enter and leave timeouts to `0`, `null`, or `undefined`. Make sure your
child has a new key as well.

contentTransitionEnterTimeout.description:
The transition enter timeout for when the main content changes. Settings this value
to `0`, `null`, or `undefined` will disable the enter transition.

contentTransitionLeaveTimeout.description:
The transition leave timeout for when the main content changes. Settings this value
to `0`, `null`, or `undefined` will disable the leave transition.
